creative_patterns: Start with an immediate hook or surprising element to capture attention.
Use fast-paced cuts and transitions to maintain viewer interest.
Incorporate culturally relevant music tracks to enhance engagement.
Leverage trending challenges or memes in your video content.
Mix reality with augmented reality (AR) effects for a novel experience.
Include text overlays that highlight key points or calls to action.
Feature authentic, user-generated content for relatability.
Encourage viewer interaction through questions or prompts in the video.
Include behind-the-scenes footage to humanize the brand.
Animate text or graphic elements to emphasize movement and vitality.
Utilize split-screen and picture-in-picture effects for dynamic storytelling.
Incorporate countdown timers to create urgency.
Use jump cuts to enhance narrative speed and engagement.
Highlight diverse voices and faces to broaden appeal.
Show transformations or before-and-after sequences to demonstrate change.
Employ voiceovers to add personal touch and narration.
Use hyperlapse effects for compressing time in dynamic scenes.
Feature influencers or niche personalities to leverage their audience.
cadence_rules: Open with the most engaging content in the first 1-2 seconds.
Keep the video tempo upbeat with periodic increases in pace.
Alternate between wide and close-up shots every 2-4 seconds.
Use text overlays within the first few seconds to contextualize content.
Include scene changes every 3-5 seconds to prevent viewer fatigue.
Match video transitions with changes in music tempo or beat.
Gradually increase the pace towards the climax of the video.
Avoid long static shots; introduce movement if necessary.
Integration of cuts and transitions should align seamlessly with the video's narrative.
Utilize audio cues to signal important transitions.
Ensure any overlays maintain readability across different device sizes.
Keep individual scene lengths short, typically under 5 seconds.
do_not_do: Avoid using overly complex overlays that can distract from main content.
Do not start with a brand logo or tagline.
Avoid long monologue formats; keep dialogue concise and snappy.
Refrain from using copyrighted music without proper licenses.
Do not rely solely on visual effects that add no substance.
Avoid using low-quality or pixelated visuals.
Do not ignore current platform trends; adapt where possible.
Avoid cluttered visual elements that can overwhelm the viewer.
Do not use too many fast cuts, which can cause motion sickness.
Refrain from marginalizing or excluding diverse voices.
Avoid content that doesn't align with the brand's core message.
Do not use long intros that delay the main content.
Avoid ending videos abruptly without a concise conclusion.
Do not overlook the importance of subtitles for sound-off viewing.
